result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Geoffrey Phillip Salaja was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Geoffrey Phillip Salaja was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Geoffrey Phillip Salaja in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Geoffrey Phillip Salaja in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is set for Sentencing in Waushara County as well which is mentioned in the reports but not a part of this case.  Atty Hendee received a copy of the recocation packet and have no changes.  Atty Gumz received a copy of the revocation packet and have no corrections.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Hannah Salaja (defendant's daughter) makes a statement to the court.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 4 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
Credit = 161 days
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
Substance Abuse Program
Costs to be converted to a Civil Judgment
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Ct. 3:  Court orders 1 year in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 204 days
Time Served
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 1, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Petition for Half-Priced IID

& Affidavit to Exempt Vehicles
  Signed by BNB/8-3-16

Defendant Geoffrey Phillip Salaja in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was put on the calendar based on the defendant letter to appeal the revocation of his huber.  Court questions the defendant.  Mr. Salaja states that he has the exempt paperwork; he has one vehicle that is not exempt.  Defendant states that his daughter and son are going to help him get the IID installed while he is in jail.  
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is in Waushara County jail serving the sentenece; defendant needs to make sure that once he complies with the IID, Marquette County would have to be informed.

BY THE COURT:   Court will sign the exemption paperwork that the defendant provided to the court.
Hearing on August 3, 2016 at 11:30 am.
from DA dated 7/20/16

from Geoffrey Salaja dated 7/16/16
- per Judge; set hearing

Order - Defendant to reimburse County for payment of attorney fees
Signed by Judge Bult 07-14-16

Motion to Revoke Huber Privilege/Order
Signed by Judge Bult 07-13-16
MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION
Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Geoffrey Phillip Salaja in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee will be filing an amended information adding two counts; those two counts are consolidated from Green Lake County case #15CF42.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 3.  Counts 2 & 4 to be dismissed.
Atty Peebles agrees with the consolidation.
BY THE COURT:  Court will accept the consolidation from Green Lake County case.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3.  Counts 2 & 4 to be dismissed.
No PSI required

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Peebles makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; to begin after the Count 3 sentence and after the current sentence in Waushara County
*Credit = 0 days
*May serve in Waushara County

Count 3:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*9 months conditional time in the Marquette County Jail w/huber, to be served at same time as Waushara Co. jail time
*Report forthwith
*Credit = 0 days
*Good Time
*May serve in Waushara County
*3 years DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Pay $1,000 + costs
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Pay $42.50 for blood draw from Green Lake County case
*DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $250 Surcharge

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Copy of Information from Green Lake County case 15CF42
